verses.text: And the \sc Lord\sc* spake unto Moses in mount Sinai, saying,
Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye come into the land which I give you, then shall the land keep a sabbath unto the \sc Lord\sc*.
Six years thou shalt sow thy field, and six years thou shalt prune thy vineyard, and gather in the fruit thereof;
but in the seventh year shall be a sabbath of rest unto the land, a sabbath for the \sc Lord\sc*: thou shalt neither sow thy field, nor prune thy vineyard.
That which groweth of it own accord of thy harvest thou shalt not reap, neither gather the grapes of thy vine undressed: \add for\add* it is a year of rest unto the land.
And the sabbath of the land shall be meat for you; for thee, and for thy servant, and for thy maid, and for thy hired servant, and for thy stranger that sojourneth with thee,
and for thy cattle, and for the beast that \add are\add* in thy land, shall all the increase thereof be meat.
And thou shalt number seven sabbaths of years unto thee, seven times seven years; and the space of the seven sabbaths of years shall be unto thee forty and nine years.
Then shalt thou cause the trumpet of the jubile to sound on the tenth \add day\add* of the seventh month, in the day of atonement shall ye make the trumpet sound throughout all your land.

And ye shall hallow the fiftieth year, and proclaim liberty throughout \add all\add* the land unto all the inhabitants thereof: it shall be a jubile unto you; and ye shall return every man unto his possession, and ye shall return every man unto his family.
A jubile shall that fiftieth year be unto you: ye shall not sow, neither reap that which groweth of itself in it, nor gather \add the grapes\add* in it of thy vine undressed.
For it \add is\add* the jubile; it shall be holy unto you: ye shall eat the increase thereof out of the field.
In the year of this jubile ye shall return every man unto his possession.
And if thou sell ought unto thy neighbour, or buyest \add ought\add* of thy neighbour’s hand, ye shall not oppress one another:
according to the number of years after the jubile thou shalt buy of thy neighbour, \add and\add* according unto the number of years of the fruits he shall sell unto thee:

according to the multitude of years thou shalt increase the price thereof, and according to the fewness of years thou shalt diminish the price of it: for \add according to\add* the number \add of the years\add* of the fruits doth he sell unto thee.
Ye shall not therefore oppress one another; but thou shalt fear thy God: for I \add am\add* the \sc Lord\sc* your God.
Wherefore ye shall do my statutes, and keep my judgments, and do them; and ye shall dwell in the land in safety.
And the land shall yield her fruit, and ye shall eat \add your\add* fill, and dwell therein in safety.
And if ye shall say, What shall we eat the seventh year? behold, we shall not sow, nor gather in our increase:
then I will command my blessing upon you in the sixth year, and it shall bring forth fruit for three years.
And ye shall sow the eighth year, and eat \add yet\add* of old fruit until the ninth year; until her fruits come in ye shall eat \add of\add* the old \add store\add*.
The land shall not be sold for ever: for the land \add is\add* mine; for ye \add were\add* strangers and sojourners with me.
And in all the land of your possession ye shall grant a redemption for the land.
If thy brother be waxen poor, and hath sold away \add some\add* of his possession, and \add if any of\add* his kin come to redeem it, then shall he redeem that which his brother sold.
And if the man have none to redeem \add it\add*, and himself be able to redeem it;
then let him count the years of the sale thereof, and restore the overplus unto the man to whom he sold it; that he may return unto his possession.

But if he be not able to restore \add it\add* to him, then that which is sold shall remain in the hand of him that hath bought it until the year of jubile: and in the jubile it shall go out, and he shall return unto his possession.
And if a man sell a dwelling house in a walled city, then he may redeem it within a whole year after it is sold; \add within\add* a full year may he redeem it.

And if it be not redeemed within the space of a full year, then the house that \add is\add* in the walled city shall be stablished for ever to him that bought it throughout his generations: it shall not go out in the jubile.
But the houses of the villages which have no wall round about them shall be counted as the fields of the country: they may be redeemed, and they shall go out in the jubile.
Notwithstanding the cities of the Levites, \add and\add* the houses of the cities of their possession, may the Levites redeem at any time.

And if a man purchase of the Levites, then the house that was sold, and the city of his possession, shall go out in the \add year of\add* jubile: for the houses of the cities of the Levites \add are\add* their possession among the children of Israel.
But the field of the suburbs of their cities may not be sold; for it \add is\add* their perpetual possession.
And if thy brother be waxen poor, and fallen in decay with thee; then thou shalt relieve him: \add yea, though he be\add* a stranger, or a sojourner; that he may live with thee.
Take thou no usury of him, or increase: but fear thy God; that thy brother may live with thee.
Thou shalt not give him thy money upon usury, nor lend him thy victuals for increase.
I \add am\add* the \sc Lord\sc* your God, which brought you forth out of the land of Egypt, to give you the land of Canaan, \add and\add* to be your God.
And if thy brother \add that dwelleth\add* by thee be waxen poor, and be sold unto thee; thou shalt not compel him to serve as a bondservant:
\add but\add* as a hired servant, \add and\add* as a sojourner, he shall be with thee, \add and\add* shall serve thee unto the year of jubile:
and \add then\add* shall he depart from thee, \add both\add* he and his children with him, and shall return unto his own family, and unto the possession of his fathers shall he return.
For they \add are\add* my servants, which I brought forth out of the land of Egypt: they shall not be sold as bondmen.
Thou shalt not rule over him with rigour; but shalt fear thy God.
Both thy bondmen, and thy bondmaids, which thou shalt have, \add shall be\add* of the heathen that \add are\add* round about you; of them shall ye buy bondmen and bondmaids.

Moreover of the children of the strangers that do sojourn among you, of them shall ye buy, and of their families that \add are\add* with you, which they begat in your land: and they shall be your possession.

And ye shall take them as an inheritance for your children after you, to inherit \add them for\add* a possession; they shall be your bondmen for ever: but over your brethren the children of Israel, ye shall not rule one over another with rigour.

And if a sojourner or stranger wax rich by thee, and thy brother \add that dwelleth\add* by him wax poor, and sell himself unto the stranger \add or\add* sojourner by thee, or to the stock of the stranger’s family:
after \add that\add* he is sold he may be redeemed again; one of his brethren may redeem him:
either his uncle, or his uncle’s son, may redeem him, or \add any\add* that is nigh of kin unto him of his family may redeem him; or if he be able, he may redeem himself.

And he shall reckon with him that bought him from the year that he was sold to him unto the year of jubile: and the price of his sale shall be according unto the number of years, according to the time of a hired servant shall it be with him.
If \add there be\add* yet many years \add behind\add*, according unto them he shall give again the price of his redemption out of the money that he was bought for.
And if there remain but few years unto the year of jubile, then he shall count with him, \add and\add* according unto his years shall he give \add him\add* again the price of his redemption.
\add And\add* as a yearly hired servant shall he be with him: \add and the other\add* shall not rule with rigour over him in thy sight.
And if he be not redeemed in these \add years\add*, then he shall go out in the year of jubile, \add both\add* he, and his children with him.
For unto me the children of Israel \add are\add* servants; they \add are\add* my servants whom I brought forth out of the land of Egypt: I \add am\add* the \sc Lord\sc* your God.
